revision.text:
{{Wireless embedded system |brand=ASUS |model=RT-AC68 |revision=U (v1S) |serialnum_prefix=(90IG00C1-BM3000) |series=AC1900 |upc=886227419005 |asin=B00FB45SI4 |newegg=N82E16833320174 |price=220 |est_release_date=10/09/2013 |fcc_date=09/30/2013 |manuf_country=China |is_manuf=No |manuf=Askey |manuf_rev= |availability=common |type=wireless router |fcc_id=MSQ-RTAC68U |ic_id=3568A-RTAC68U |pcb_id= |pwr_v=19 |pwr_amp=1.75 |pwr_conn=barrel |cpu1_brand=Broadcom |cpu1_model=BCM4708A0 |cpu1_cspeed=800 |cpu1_cores=2 |fla1=128 |fla1_brand=Spansion |fla1_model=S34ML01G100TFI00 |ram1=256 |ram1_brand=ESMT |ram1_model=M15F2G16128A-ADB |expansion_if_types=USB 2.0, USB 3.0 |expansion_usb_num=2 |serial=yes,, 4-pin header |wi1_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi1_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1308 P20, 266562 3 W; |wi1_802dot11_protocols=bgn |wi1_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi1_txchains=3 |wi1_rxchains=3 |wi1_sstreams=3 |wi2_chip1_brand=Broadcom |wi2_chip1_model=BCM4360;BCM4360KMLG, TE1308 P20, 266562 3 W; |wi2_802dot11_protocols=an+ac |wi2_ant_conn=RP-SMA |wi2_txchains=3 |wi2_rxchains=3 |wi2_sstreams=3 |eth_cpu=true |sw_cpu=true |lan_speed=1GbE |lan_ports=4 |wan_speed=1GbE |wan_ports=1 |addl_chips=2.4GHz Power Amplifier IC;Richwave;RTC6649E;;3; ,,, 5GHz Power Amplifier IC;Skyworks;SE5023L;SiGe, 5023L, TW;3; |flags=AiCloud support, AiMesh, |stock_boot=CFE;1.0.1.9; |stock_os=Linux;2.6.36;brcmarm; |tp_firmware=Asuswrt-Merlin, DD-WRT, Tomato (shibby), Tomato RAF (Victek), FreshTomato-ARM, |802dot11_protocols=abgn+ac |default_ssid=ASUS, ASUS_5G |default_ssid_regex=^ASUS$,,, ^ASUS 5G$ |default_ip=192.168.1.1 |default_user=admin |default_pass=admin |oui=74:D0:2B |oui_eth=74:D0:2B }}
:• '''1300''' Mbps max PHY rate for the 80MHz wide 5GHz channel, :• '''600''' Mbps max. PHY rate for the 40MHz wide 2.4GHz channel = '''''1900 Mbps'' class'''
{{TagLine|Wireless-AC1900 Dual Band Gigabit Router}} :[http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68U/ Product page] *Model Part Num: 90IG00C1-BM3000 {{WiFiCert|WFA19421|08/29/2013}} :This certification also applies to the ''RT-AC68R''. This device would seem to be running Linux kernel 2.6.36.4 (brcmarm). Note: A tag line of ''802.11ac Concurrent Dual-band AC1900 Router'' ''(600Mbps/2.4GHz* +
1300Mbps/5GHz)'' w/ [https://github.com/RMerl/asuswrt-merlin/blob/master/release/src/router/www/EN.dict ''ASUSWRT'' source] to the RT-AC68U, RT-AC68U v2, RT-AC69U. ===FCC info=== *The ''ASUS'' logo, "RT-AC68U" and "REV 1.60" is silkscreened on the board. *The manufacturer stated in the test report is ''[[Askey]] Technology (Jiangsu)'' Per the FCC photos... *The SoC used would seem to be BCM4708A0/BCM4709A0 :(BCM470[8/9]A0KFEBG, TT1311 P10, 272573-04 B18) :Visual inspection of actual product confirms ''BCM4708A'' *Two BCM4360 provide the wireless interfaces for this device. *The shown power supply is an ''ASUS'' branded AD890326 :(100-240VAC ~ 50/60Hz, 0.8A -> 19VDC, 1.75A). ===Additional specifications=== :per ''ASUS'''s product page *''Expansion IFs:'' 1x USB 2.0, 1x USB 3.0 *''Dimensions (W x H x D):'' [[Dimensions::220 mm x 160 mm x 83.3 mm]] *''Weight:'' [[Weight::640 g]] ===Reviews=== *''Inside Story: [[ASUS RT-AC56U]] & RT-AC68U'' [http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-features/32120-inside-story-asus-rt-ac56u-and-rt-ac68u on '''SmallNetBuilder'''] :Per ''SNB'''s conversation w/ [[Broadcom]], ''TurboQAM'' functionality is integrated :into ''Broadcom'' 802.11ac chips - allowing ''QAM256'' usage in 2.4GHz band. *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-reviews/32239-ac1900-first-look-netgear-r7000-a-asus-rt-ac68u ''AC1900 First Look: NETGEAR R7000 & ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''SNB'''] *[http://reviews.cnet.com/routers/asus-rt-ac68u-dual/4505-3319_7-35828165.html ''ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''C|Net'''] (Rev A1 unit, 74:D0:2B OUI) *[http://foxnetlab.com/index.php/16-reviews/92-the-new-wireless-flagship-device-or-asus-rt-ac68u ''The New Wireless Flagship Device or ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''FoxNetLab'''] *[https://openitforum.pl/index/recenzje/routery/asus/rt-ac68u/ ''ASUS RT-AC68U'' on '''OpenITforum'''] ===Forum threads=== *[http://wl500g.info/showthread.php?30722-Asus-RT-AC56U-802-11ac-Gigabit-DualBand-Wireless-Router&p=258196#post258196 On '''wl500g'''] *[http://forum.ixbt.com/topic.cgi?id=14:58696-2#30 On '''IXBT'''] *[http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/internet-bandwidth-networking-clinic-4/%5Bupcoming%5D-asus-rt-ac67u-dual-band-wireless-ac1900-router-4116129.html On '''HardWareZone'''] :[http://forums.hardwarezone.com.sg/internet-bandwidth-networking-clinic-4/%5Bmaylyns-review%5D-asus-rt-ac66u-dark-knight-rises-3845510-50.html Image of the device on ''maylyn'''s AC66U review thread] ===Third party firmware support=== *[http://svn.dd-wrt.com/changeset/21018 Experimental '''DD-WRT''' support in SVN ''r21018''] ===News=== *[https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=q-xghKyW_QI ''CES 2013 Day 0 - ASUS Networking Products'' on YouTube] (3:30) *[http://press.asus.com/asus-announces-next-generation-wi-fi-devices-and-new-portable-projector/ ''ASUS Announces Next-Generation Wi-Fi Devices'' - ''ASUS'' Press Release] *[http://www.smallnetbuilder.com/wireless/wireless-news/31778-broadcom-announces-beefed-up-socs-to-power-up-draft-80211ac-products ''Broadcom Announces Beefed-Up SoCs To Power Up Draft 802.11ac
Products'' on SmallNetBuilder] (BCM4708x series announcement stuff) ====Additional vendor links==== [http://www.newegg.com/Product/Product.aspx?Item=N82E16833320174&Tpk=ASUS%20RT-AC68U/ On '''Newegg''' (preorder only)] (source of the release date and price) ===See also=== *[[ASUS RT-AC68U]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68U/ Product Page] *[[ASUS RT-AC68P]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68P/ Product Page] *[[ASUS RT-AC68R]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68R/ Product Page] *[[ASUS RT-AC68W]] • [http://www.asus.com/Networking/RTAC68W/ Product Page] __NOTOC__ ==T-Mobile Personal Cellspot Router (TM-AC1900)== ===Support=== * [http://www.asus.com/supportonly/TM-AC1900/ Support page] for [[ASUS TM-AC1900]] * [https://support.t-mobile.com/community/coverage/personal-cellspot/wi-fi-cellspot-router T-Mobile Support page] *T-Mobile released a wireless router rebranded from the RT-AC68U. :The T-Mobile rebranded version has a custom proprietary firmware :that is modified for optimizing the T-Mobile Wi-Fi calling feature. :This router requires a refundable $25 deposit (or none if qualified) for postpaid :plan customers [$99 for retail pricing/prepaid accounts] since this is a lease. *''Notice'': If you got this router as a postpaid customer, keep in mind that T-Mobile expects :it back after you cancel your T-Mobile service or if a coverage line is disconnected :from a family/multiple line account within 45 days after cancellation/disconnection. :Failure to do so may incur a $99 non-return fee. If the router is returned damaged, $25. :[This doesn't apply to prepaid customers or if bought in retail price.] __NOTOC__
